column2:
name
  1. Nickname for a popular street singer named Enrico Molaschi, and later a nickname for all similar street performers in Milan.

name
  1. Equivalent of male English given name Blaise (and its doublet Blasius)

name
  1. Milan (the capital city of Lombardy, Italy)
  2. Milan (a metropolitan city of Lombardy, Italy)

noun
  1. (Classical Milanese orthography) A Lombard dish made from pork and cabbage.

noun
  1. (Northwest Lombardy, Classical Milanese orthography) Alternative form of cazzoeula

noun
  1. (vulgar, anatomy) Spelling alternative of cul, buttock, arse

noun
  1. (anatomy) heart
  2. (geometry) heart, heart shape
  3. heart (love)
  4. (card games) hearts (the suit)
  5. (physics) the core of a nuclear reactor

adv
  1. (Eastern Lombard) there (in the expression of "there be")

pron
  1. (Eastern Lombard) him; her/it (dative case)
  2. (Eastern Lombard) them (dative case)

adv
  1. (Western Lombard) there (in the expression of "there be")

pron
  1. (Western Lombard) him; her/it (dative case)
  2. (Western Lombard) them (dative case)

verb
  1. (Scriver Lombard, transitive, intransitive) to eat

noun
  1. (usually uncountable) food

verb
  1. (transitive) to drown
  2. (transitive) to deny, to not allow

noun
  1. wheel (a circular device capable of rotating on its axis)
  2. cartwheel (a gymnastic maneuver whereby the gymnast rotates to one side)

noun
  1. boulder, mass of stone, cliff, elevation
  2. rock, stone
  3. a kind of rock (clastic rock)
